oai_dc:dc.dc:title: On indexing sliding windows over online data streams
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: GOLAB, L
GARG, S
OZSU, MT
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We consider indexing sliding windows in main memory over on-line data streams. Our proposed data structures and query semantics are based on a division of the sliding window into sub-windows. By classifying windowed operators according to their method of execution, we motivate the need for two types of windowed indices: those which provide a list of attribute values and their counts for answering set-valued queries, and those which provide direct access to tuples for answering attribute-valued queries. We propose and evaluate indices for both of these cases and show that our techniques are more efficient than executing windowed queries without an index.
